org.cmapi.primitives

Class GeoLookAt

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cmapi.primitives.GeoBase
      • org.cmapi.primitives.GeoLookAt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGeoAltitudeMode, IGeoBase, IGeoLookAt, IGeoPosition

    public class GeoLookAt
extends GeoBase
implements IGeoLookAt
    The LookAt element positions the 'camera' in relation to the IGeoPosition that is being viewed

      • setTilt

        public void setTilt(double tilt)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoLookAt
        Rotation, in degrees, of the camera around the X axis. A value of 0 indicates that the view is aimed straight down toward the earth (the most common case). A value for 90 for indicates that the view is aimed toward the horizon. Values greater than 90 indicate that the view is pointed up into the sky. Values for are clamped at +180 degrees.
        Specified by:
        setTilt in interface IGeoLookAt
        Parameters:
        tilt - Rotation, in degrees, of the camera around the X axis. A value of 0 indicates that the view is aimed straight down toward the earth (the most common case). A value for 90 for indicates that the view is aimed toward the horizon. Values greater than 90 indicate that the view is pointed up into the sky. Values for are clamped at +180 degrees.

      • getTilt

        public double getTilt()
        Specified by:
        getTilt in interface IGeoLookAt
        Returns:
        tilt Rotation, in degrees, of the camera around the X axis. A value of 0 indicates that the view is aimed straight down toward the earth (the most common case). A value for 90 for indicates that the view is aimed toward the horizon. Values greater than 90 indicate that the view is pointed up into the sky. Values for are clamped at +180 degrees.

      • setHeading

        public void setHeading(double heading)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoLookAt
        Direction (that is, North, South, East, West), in degrees. Default=0 (North). Values range from 0 to 360 degrees
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
